alert.note: Alert for Western Prince William Sound (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued December 25 at 4:40AM AKST until December 27 at 12:00AM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH NOW IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY MORNING THROUGH SUNDAY EVENING NORTH OF THE STERLING HIGHWAY JUNCTION... * WHAT...Freezing rain with significant icing possible. Total ice accumulations of up to one quarter inch possible. * WHERE...Eastern Kenai Peninsula north of the Sterling Highway junction, including Turnagain Pass and eastern Turnagain Arm. * WHEN...From Sunday morning through Sunday evening. * IMPACTS...Power outages and tree damage are possible due to the ice. Travel could be extremely hazardous. The hazardous conditions could impact holiday travel on Sunday. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Areas of light snow are expected to develop early Sunday morning and quickly transition to freezing rain. Temperatures will likely vary along the Seward Highway, with warmer temperatures at higher elevations, ultimately rising above freezing by Sunday afternoon. Lower elevations and protected valleys will hold on to the colder air and see the most freezing rain and ice accumulation.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
